Prop.Name: Function app
Prop.Description: Name of the Function app in Azure. It must start with a letter and only contain letters, numbers, _, and -, up to 127 characters in length.

Prop.Name: Resource group
Prop.Description: Name of the resource group where the function app is defined in Azure.

Group.Name: Identity Configuration (Service Principal)
Group.Description: An Azure Service Principal is an identity created for use with applications, hosted services, and automated tools to access Azure resources.

Prop.Name: Application Id
Prop.Description: Application (client) ID of the Service Principal.

Prop.Name: Tenant Id
Prop.Description: Directory (tenant) ID of the Service Principal.

Prop.Name: Credentials
Prop.Description: Password of the Service Principal.

Prop.Name: GAM connection key
Prop.Description: GAM connection key.

Prop.Name: Trigger Type
Prop.Description: Trigger type of the function. Values: Timer-> A timer trigger lets you run a function on a schedule. Queue-> A Queue Storage trigger function. Service Bus-> A Service Bus trigger function.

Prop.Name: Function name
Prop.Description: Name of the function to be defined on the cloud. The name must be unique within a project, start with a letter and only contain letters, numbers, _, and -, up to 127 characters in length.

Prop.Name: Route Prefix
Prop.Description: By default, all function routes are prefixed with rest. You can also customize or remove the prefix using this property.

Prop.Name: Schedule time Format
Prop.Description: Format in which the time is to be specified. Values: Time Value expression->It can be an NCRONTAB expression or a TimeSpan expression. An NCRONTAB expression is similar to a CRON expression except that it includes an additional sixth field at the beginning to use for time precision in seconds:{second} {minute} {hour} {day} {month} {day-of-week}. E.g.: 0 5 * * * * (Once every hour of the day at minute 5 of each hour). Unlike a CRON expression, a TimeSpan value specifies the time interval between each function invocation. When a function completes after running longer than the specified interval, the timer immediately invokes the function again. E.g.:"00:01:00" (every minute). App setting property name and value->Define a property value pair for the definition of the App setting and its value. If the value is left empty, you need to define it on Azure portal.

Value.desc: App setting property name and value

Prop.Name: Schedule time value
Prop.Description: Schedule time expressed in NCRONTAB or TimeSpan format. E.g.: 0 0 */2 * * * (every day every 2 hours).

Prop.Name: App setting property name
Prop.Description: App setting name to be defined on Azure that will be used to set the schedule time.

Prop.Name: App setting property value
Prop.Description: App setting value to be defined on Azure that will be used to set the schedule time. The value can be set as an NCRONTAB or TimeSpan expression (e.g.: 0 0 */2 * * *).

Prop.Name: Queue Name
Prop.Description: The name of the queue to poll.

Prop.Name: Name
Prop.Description: The name of an app setting that contains the Storage connection string to use for this binding. If you leave connection empty, the Functions runtime uses the default Storage connection string in the app setting that is named AzureWebJobsStorage.

Prop.Name: Value
Prop.Description: The value to assign to the Queue Connection app setting.

Prop.Name: Service Bus type
Prop.Description: The type of the Service Bus.

Prop.Name: Queue name
Prop.Description: Name of the queue to monitor.

Prop.Name: Topic name
Prop.Description: Name of the topic to monitor.

Prop.Name: Subscription name
Prop.Description: Name of the subscription to monitor.

Prop.Name: Name
Prop.Description: The name of an app setting that contains the Service Bus connection string to use for this binding. If you leave connection empty, the Functions runtime uses the default Service Bus connection string in the app setting that is named "AzureWebJobsServiceBus".

Prop.Name: Value
Prop.Description: The value to assign to the Connection app setting.

Prop.Name: Is session enabled
Prop.Description: True if connecting to a session-aware queue or subscription. False otherwise, which is the default value.

Prop.Name: Session State Provider
Prop.Description: Session state provider to be used.

Prop.Name: Provider Address
Prop.Description: Session state provider address.

Prop.Name: Provider Password
Prop.Description: Session state provider password.

Prop.Name: Provider Instance name
Prop.Description: Session state provider instance name.

Prop.Name: Session Timeout
Prop.Description: Time (minutes) for the session to be valid. The session is refreshed in each Http request. It becomes invalid after session timeout minutes of inactivity.

Prop.Name: APIM service name
Prop.Description: The name of the Api Management service instance.

Prop.Name: APIM resource group
Prop.Description: Azure API Management resource group.

Prop.Name: API Identification
Prop.Description: API revision identifier. Must be unique in the current API Management service instance.

Prop.Name: API display name
Prop.Description: Display name of this API.

Prop.Name: API backend service URL
Prop.Description: Absolute URL of the backend service implementing this API. Cannot be more than 2000 characters long. E.g: https://MyFunctionApp.azurewebsites.net

Prop.Name: API path
Prop.Description: Relative URL uniquely identifying this API and all of its resource paths within the API Management service instance.

Prop.Name: API version
Prop.Description: Describes the Version of the Api. If you add a version to a non-versioned API, an Original version will be automatically created and will respond on the default URL.

Prop.Name: API Version Set Id
Prop.Description: A resource identifier for the related Api Version Set.

Prop.Name: API Version Set display name
Prop.Description: Name of API Version Set.

Prop.Name: API subscription required
Prop.Description: If true, the API requires a subscription key on requests.
